page.title: 02Tourism in Haverfordwest
page.content: Haverfordwest in the very centre of the old county of Pembrokeshire is in an ideal situation,one would think,for touring the area--but with only a few hotels and limited attractions, it proves to be a wet weather haunt or information and shopping stop-over. Hotels and guest houses have given way to chalets, caravans and tents nearer the coast. Hotels of note are: Hotel Mariners 28 bedrooms,24 en-suite, Pembroke House Hotel 23 bedrooms,21 en-suite,County Hotel 20 bedrooms,2 en-suite. Numbers of visitors recorded; The Castle Museum 1983--26000 1984--24000 National Park Centre 1983--25260 1984--24695 Traffic is conjested in summer at week ends and during the local Agri. Show.
